channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10950] Add a configuration point for MaxVersion of Column Family
item.description:
Starting on 0.96.0. HColumnDescriptor.DEFAULT_VERSIONS change to 1 from 3. So a columnfamily will be default have 1 version of data. Currently a user can specifiy the maxVersion during create table time or alter the columnfam later. This feature will add a configuration point in hbase-sit.xml so that an admin can set the default globally.

a small discussion in HBASE-10941 lead to this jira
item.summary: Add a configuration point for MaxVersion of Column Family

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Enoch Hsu, thanks for working on this jira.
Nick Dimiduk, Enoch from my team will provide the patch for this jira. is there a way to assign the jira to him? thanks

Added patch to fix and a UT to test the change.
UT was added to hbase-server because of usage of HBaseTestingUtility.
If I add the UT to hbase-client then it creates a circular dependency on hbase-server

+  public static final int DEFAULT_VERSIONS = HBaseConfiguration.create().getInt(

+    "hbase.column.MaxVersion", 1);

There is no need to use mixed cases in config parameter name. How about naming this 'hbase.column.max.version' ?

For TestColumnDescriptorDefaultVersion.java, I think the file should be named TestColumnDescriptorDefaultVersions.java since we allow the user to set default versions value.


+ * Copyright The Apache Software Foundation Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under

Please copy copyright from existing file - the format is off.


+ * Verify that the HTableDescriptor is updated after addColumn(), deleteColumn() and modifyTable()

The above javadoc (HTableDescriptor) doesn't seem to align with the class name.

I ran the new test:


Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestColumnDescriptorDefaultVersion

Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 18.096 sec

It should be medium test.

Added a new patch with changes made to match Ted's comments
Thanks for the help Ted

This message is automatically generated.

This isn't quite right.

-  public static final int DEFAULT_VERSIONS = 1;

+  public static final int DEFAULT_VERSIONS = HBaseConfiguration.create().getInt(

+    "hbase.column.max.version", 1);

DEFAULT_VERSIONS shouldn't change. Instead, you should change the places it's referenced to retrieve the site-configured default value first, and then fall back to the column descriptor.

Also, creating a config inplace like this is goofy. It means people won't have a chance to add customizations to their conf object before it's parsed. Better to use the appropriate conf object for the context.

isnt that what .getInt() does? my understanding is it attempts to retrieve the config value (which in this case is from hbase-site.xml) and if there is none will set it to 1. which was the original default value.

Or are you saying that places that call "HColumnDescriptor.getMaxVersions()" should instead first do some sort of call to a config object to retrieve hbase.column.max.version and if that is null then call HColumnDescriptor.getMaxVersions?

I also am not quite sure what you mean by "people won't have a chance to add customizations to their conf object". They can just add it to hbase-site.xml and it will get parsed in won't it? At least that is the behavior I observed when testing hbase shell

I'm suggesting a pattern more like other config access

public static final DEFAULT_VERSIONS = 1;

...

int myMaxVersions = conf.getInt("hbase.column.max.version", DEFAULT_VERSIONS);

However, looking at how DEFAULT_VERSIONS is used consumed in the codebase, it's mostly in static initializers and not convenient for configuration override. For instance, it's use in HColumnDescriptor(byte[]) isn't amiable to a local configuration context.

They can just add it to hbase-site.xml and it will get parsed in won't it?

Yes, this is true for deployments. I'm thinking in mind of tests and other runtime scenarios where it may be desirable to override this value. When the configs are read statically at class load time, there's no opportunity to inject an override to this behavior.

In light of that, I revoke my objection to this approach.

Why is the test in package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler? I think it should be in org.apache.hadoop.hbase. Test name should be Test*H*ColumnDescriptorDefaultVersions.

Cleanup those two nits and I think you're good to go.

Changed package to org.apache.hadoop.hbase and testname to TestHColumnDescriptorDefaultVersions

Uploaded new patch revision

v3 has +1 from me. Ted Yu?

Andrew Purtell, stack any objections to this patch going into your respective branches? It's not a new feature per say, but it's also not a bug fix. Comments on the chosen configuration variable name?

v3 is good by me.
Given the intent of this change we should have an entry in hbase-defaults.xml with doc in the entry. Then +1 for commit to trunk and 0.98

Right. How does this look?
<property>
<name>hbase.column.max.version</name>
<value>1</value>
<description>The default number of versions to keep which is set in a table's Column Descriptor</description>
</property>

Looks ok, or how about for description:

"New column family descriptors will use this value as the default number of versions to keep."

?
Patch v4 adds config param to hbase-default.xml

thanks for adding that in Ted
was just about to get around to that
